content:
The document presents a collection of interval classes in Python, including `LerpNodePath`, `WaitInterval`, and various function-based intervals (`LerpFunctionInterval` and others), which are used to manage animations or transformations. The provided chunk emphasizes that many of these intervals are derived from `CInterval` (rather than the base `Interval`) to enable high-performance execution in C++, making them suitable for performance-critical applications.

#
# Most of the intervals defined in this module--the group up here at
# the front of the file--are now derived from a CInterval instead of
# an Interval, so they can run in the low-level C++ code at high
# performance.
#
